website_summaries.verdict: Shoppers looking for a smaller electric mini bike packed with safety features will not be disappointed. Ideal as a "starter" model for casual riders on flat terrain.
cons: Limited battery life, even after full charge

website_summaries.verdict: A sporty, well-made bike that won't work for all kids, but provides up to 40 minutes of action-packed ride time per charge for youths who are developing motocross skills.
pros: Combines adequate speed for youngsters (12 mph), long battery life, and design ideal for boys and girls learning motocross racing
Tires offer excellent traction for tackling dirt mounds
Handle bars adjust for a customized ride
cons: Takes almost 12 hours to get a full charge
Best for beginners, as kids capable of handling faster speeds will likely find it under-powered

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for a 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my son for Christmas and he loves it! He's only 5 but he fits it perfectly. My 8 year looks too big for this dirt bike and the "recommended age" is 13! I would not recommend buying it for a 13 year old. This little thing is pretty fast and holds a charge for quite some time. If your kiddo can ride a bike without training wheels pretty well, then they'll probably be just fine on this.
customer_reviews.author: Charissa

customer_reviews.title: Endless Fun for our 5 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my sons 5th birthday and it is perfect for him! He already knew how to ride a bike very well so this was an easy transition for him. He's average size and fits this bike really well with a little bit of room to grow. He LOVES this dirtbike and is already insists he's going to learn to do a wheelie. The video is on his 2nd day of riding it. His cousin who is 7 also rode it and was a bit tall but it still worked well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: ... about the suspension (I always make sure I read bad reviews to see what most of the problems are
customer_reviews.text: I was scared to get this based on other reviews about the suspension (I always make sure I read bad reviews to see what most of the problems are.) However, I'm glad I got this little bike. It's so fun and my husband and I are about to ride it, though it is really small it packs some power. I'm able to ride with my 5 year old around our neighborhood and our yard (I weigh 98 lbs and he weighs about 35). I'm not worried about the suspension and it's not that bad unless you're expecting this to be a true sports bike. So glad we got this!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: IT WAS QUITE EASY TO REMOVE FROM BOX AND SET UP
customer_reviews.text: MY 7 YEAR OLD GRANDSON LOVES THIS MOTOCROSS -- CAN'T KEEP HIM OFF OF IT. IT WAS QUITE EASY TO REMOVE FROM BOX AND SET UP. IF YOUR KIDDO CAN RIDE A BICYCLE WITHOUT TRAINING WHEELS THEY CAN RIDE THIS....LEARNING THE BREAKS AND HOW TO GO FAST OR SLOWER WAS QUITE EASY FOR MY GRANDSON TO MASTER. AFTER A FEW LEARNING RIDES HE QUICKLY GRASPED THE HANG OF IT AND NOW IS A PRO AT RIDING. IT DOES GO PRETTY FAST SO MAKE SURE TO HAVE SAFETY HELMET AND CLOTHES.....FAIR PRICE AND WOULD DEFINITELY BUY AGAIN!!! WILL SEE HOW IT HOLDS UP IN THE FUTURE....BUT SO FAR SO GOOD
customer_reviews.author: PAMELA P.

customer_reviews.title: Want to make your kids happy?
customer_reviews.text: My son was tickled pink when we got this for him! He is a smaller little guy at 7 years old & this fits him perfectly. We had a issue with the original charger but thankfully razor sent a replacement. It goes fast to buy a helmet! The run time isn't the greatest but he gets a few hours before it dies.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the of these for our boys for Christmas. We did not put them together until may as we live in the north country. It is now August and they are completely dead. They have always been stored out of the rain and sun and there is not explanation as to why they both died. These were too expensive to last only 3 months of use. Highly disappointed. The boys loved them while they lasted though
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Worst Bike. It is a loot...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for my son's birthday. First of all, it is very small. My 6 year old is too big on this. And, the battery died in 2 months. Customer service says that I need to charge 12 hours for 3 - 4 weeks to keep it alive, even if I am not using. Replacement battery is $70 + shipment. I would rather throw this bike in junk yard than buying a replacement battery. Never going to buy other Razor products.
customer_reviews.author: Sravan

customer_reviews.title: Only works for a year no matter how much you use it
customer_reviews.text: Just buyer beware. After you buy the bike you do have to replace the battery about once a year which is almost another $100, every year. No matter how much you use it as the battery will self deteriorate as Razor just told me. We have followed all the battery maintenance instructions and it still didn’t last. My son doesn’t have the opportunity to ride the bike as much as he would like to due to our busy schedules but the bike has very little actual ridding hours on it and now it’s useless unless I want to put another $80 into it.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Sbabo

customer_reviews.title: A very disappointing Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.text: Brand new, charged before first ride and stil doesn’t work, maybe I got a lemon who knows. Won’t be spending my money on Razor products anymore. I am currently trying to troubleshoot the bike.
customer_reviews.author: jamon powell

customer_reviews.title: This was an awesome gift for my 11 year old
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome gift for my 11 year old. The height of the bike was a little shorter than I would have wanted for my son but overall great bike. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy K. E. Coates

customer_reviews.title: It almost feels like there is some obstruction with the chain and sounds ...
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these for my 8 year old and 6 year old. The first 1 I got from walmart and had no problems. This one I got from Amazon had issues right out of the box. First when you are rolling it backwards to turn around it makes a loud clicking/grinding noise. It almost feels like there is some obstruction with the chain and sounds like it may snap. Second when driving forward it makes a loud screeching noise at times. Like I said I have another one of these and there is no issue. SHOULD HAVE STUCK WITH WALMART BECAUSE THERE ARE NO RETURNS ON THIS! VERY UPSET!
customer_reviews.author: ABuyer

customer_reviews.title: ... on Christmas morning my 8 year old was very sad it didn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: I charged it and on Christmas morning my 8 year old was very sad it didn't work properly. Lasted 5 minutes. Obviously came defective. I am not sure if it is the product or shipping issue or just bad luck but it is Christmas and I feel awful for my little boy. I am hoping Amazon takes care of this. On the website they state this product cannot be returned. Hopefully tomorrow someone gives me a better answer.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Kohler

customer_reviews.title: Small, not very sturdy, but a fine little kid bike
customer_reviews.text: The kids love this, ages 4 & 7. It is almost too small though for our tall 7 year old. The plastic (blue part) bends. Since the boys ride together often & the seat isn’t quite long enough for two riders, the plastic bends & gets stressed, turning it white. Battery life is OK, about 40 minutes. The chain did fall off a few weeks after we got it but we figured out how to fix. For the money it’s a good starter bike for ages 3-7 I guess. Just won’t last us too long
customer_reviews.author: MO&EM

customer_reviews.title: Battery Lasted for Over 1 Hour and 13.4 miles!
customer_reviews.text: Like the review says, the battery lasted a lot longer than 30 minutes. My son rode it for just over an hour and 13.4 miles at an average speed of 13 MPH. I drove behind him on a country rode just to test its range. The road was mostly flat, and he weighs about 80 pounds, so your mileage will vary depending on road conditions and weight of the rider. Very impressive!
customer_reviews.author: B&S

customer_reviews.title: Great for starter dirt bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little bike. We bought it for our 9 year son for Christmas and although it's on the small side for him (he's average height) it's perfect and he feels comfortable maneuvering. Good amount of speed and perfect entry level dirt bike. He beyond loves it! (Also, 4 stars versus 5 bc the first one we received had a leaky front tire and it was extremely hard to put air in..major disappointment as Santa brought this to us and we had to get a replacement after it was opened and set up Christmas Eve. Amazon was very gracious in their replacement and quick to resolve the matter. Very thankful for that!)
customer_reviews.author: hinchicago

customer_reviews.title: Great kid's dirtbike!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 7 and he loves this electric dirtbike. We have the 350 which looks a littel small for my son but it works fine for him. It was very easy to assemble and it seems to stay charged for quite a while. The chain has popped off the gears a couple of times if he hit the bumps too hard but its fairly easy to get back on. He mainly rides it on flat grass or street, I am not sure how well it will hold up if its used for bumpy off road terrain.
customer_reviews.author: J Dubya

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but issue with brake
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our six your old and while the size of the bike is perfect for him, the brake is too far from the handle for him to be able to safely use it. We have looked at replacing the brake with one that will fit but then it won’t have the kill switch with it. For something made for kids, the brake was poorly thought out and creates a safety hazard. Everything else about the bike is great, however; the brake is a huge issue that needs to be thought about before purchasing this item. If we had known, we would not have bought this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 8+ child in a neighborhood
customer_reviews.text: This bike was so easy to assemble charges quickly and is overall very durable. Our son loves the bike it's perfect for our small quiet neighborhood it's not as noisy as a gas bike it's very quick but allowed him too gradually learn too ride it there's a lot of control with the hand throttle and the hand brakes it's not too big can I see we're going to get a lot of use out of it because it charges so quickly the battery lasts more than 15 minutes he rode the bike all day for 1 and 1/2 days and only charged it a few seconds
customer_reviews.author: Kellen & Jason

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my 6 year old.
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my 6 year old, this was his bday present. We thought about buying a much more expensive dirt bike, but this was definitely a much smarter decision for him to start out on. And you can’t beat the cost. I believe the age on this bike says 11-12, I feel like this bike would be way too small for that age range.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Rarrat

customer_reviews.title: If your kids like to have fun, these are the answer.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these! Our family of four visited my mom and she had one of these in her garage for when the grandkids visit. It was fantastic and our two kids (ages 6 and 9) took turns riding it for the whole week. As soon as we got back to our home I bought two of these for our kids and they have been riding them for 2 months now. So much fun. We bought the Razor kids helmets as well since they are light but also protect the face. I’m a convert! Love these things!
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: 5 years and older
customer_reviews.text: Santa got this for my 5 year old. Since then he learn to ride it and also ride other people including mom. Mom and dad had ride as well and it runs amazing. I was surprise that my son was able to give me a ride and it was still running fast. The speed is good. Perfect for a 5 year old and up.
customer_reviews.author: Mass Girl

customer_reviews.title: BROKE after 2 days!
customer_reviews.text: This was very fun for my 5 year old but I'm very disappointed that after 2 days of use, it stopped working. I can't return it through Amazon and now have to contact Razor. I'm irritated after paying so much for an item and not getting any support from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mika

customer_reviews.title: No good. Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Pros. The size was good for my 7 yr old. He loved it when he saw it. Cons. Zero power whatsoever. This thing could not pull a 50 lb kid through grass or any kind of incline or any soft dirt. We were super dissatisfied and dissapointed. He could use it on flat tar only. I pulled the electric motor battery assembly and put in a small 49 cc gas motor. Much better.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bike
customer_reviews.text: Great product a little pricey for the size it is for small children would not recommend for any child over the age of 7 or if your kid is big for their age. Other than that it is a great introduction to dirt bikes as a kid grows you will need to get a larger more advanced product.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: only worked a week....
customer_reviews.text: bougt this for my (step)son for Christmas. Rode first for the first week we had it, then he went back to spend a few months with his mom in va, came back and the charge doesn't hold for anything. Have no idea how to contact razor on here about it. But it was non returnable, and came with NO warranty. paid a lot of money for something and didn't get to use it but a week
customer_reviews.author: Haley Burdette

customer_reviews.title: Too small/slow for a 80lb 8 year old.  Buy the McGrath bike instead!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bike says it goes 14mph...there is NO way. My son turned 8 and our neighbors have these types of bikes....I had no idea what a difference there is between this bike and the Mark McGrath bike....IT'S HUGE. Spend the extra money and get the better bike. The neighbor kids blow past my son on the other bike. The battery lasts 15ish minutes before the speed in noticeably slower and he insists on charging it again. If I could return this, I would and spend the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little Dirt bike.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 year old for Christmas and he loves it! I would recommend this for 5-8 year olds, it gets a bit too small for my 9 year old though. Battery lasts ~2 hours with continuous use. Super sturdy, my son ramps it in the back yard! It’s very fast for a kids toy so I would not recommend this to be the first ride on that you buy if your child hasn’t rode a ride on before.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes T.

customer_reviews.title: A great lil dirt bike!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great Christmas present to my son. He loves it! It came on time and as described. He has since out grown it but it ran him around for two years and two tire swaps. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Randyman

customer_reviews.title: Battery last over two and a half hours!
customer_reviews.text: My five year old loves the bike. Battery lasts over two and a half hours for my son. Battery hasn't died on us yet. The battery housing could have been put together a little bit better I can see gaps where moisture can get in. Would have been a lot better with shocks but this is a perfect first bike for my five-year-old! The bike is only one speed my son just keeps hitting the gas if he wants to go slower and hold on to it if he wants to go full speed.
customer_reviews.author: Sara & Joshua Garland

customer_reviews.title: Protect your Amazon account
customer_reviews.text: My 11 yo son ordered this via my amazon account. READ THE FINE PRINT. THIS CAN NOT BE RETURNED!!! So I am out $250 b/c of an 11yo. Poduct quality.. Who knows. I just thought I'd point out it is non-returnable via Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: SimoNoles

customer_reviews.title: Well built, fast enough and lots of fun for my 6 yr old.
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year loved it when he first got it and still drives it around all the time. He will be 7 soon and he tells me he is ready for a "real" one. I guess the neighborhood jerk kids told him it wasn't a real dirtbike. He has abused this thing, drove it through mud and puddles, left it out in the rain and jumped ramps with it. It is still going strong since christmas. I think it is well built and was worth every penny. he drives it around our 1 acre yard and I let him drive it up and down our dead end street. All the kids want to ride it every where we take it.
customer_reviews.author: Whitebread409

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike for 6 year old! Good quality
customer_reviews.text: What a great bike! It is the perfect size for our grandson, who is a bit tall for his 6 years. We purchased it for Christmas. He loves this bike! It holds charge a really long time, which surprised us. Good quality bike. It doesn't go overly fast so I feel comfortable letting him ride. The few falls he has had weren't too bad. You do need alot of open street to ride in and no cars! He loves it and I would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Atnip

customer_reviews.title: Great Electic Motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: Great little motorcycle. Well made and powerful enough for lots of fun. In spite of long rides, my 7 year old son has yet to run down the battery. There are no shocks so over rough terrain it might get bumpy. But the knobby tired do a good job of soaking up most bumps. Not a barn stormer going up steep hills but on moderate grades, no significant loss of speed. I would say that this bike might be too small for kids 9 years or older.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Such a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: My son was in tears when this arrived because he was so happy. He waited 24 hours until batter charged then got after it. He rode it and then unit died on day 3. We contacted customer service who was good and helpful, sent us out a new battery that showed up 7-10 days. Charged another 24 hours then day 3 died again. Contract customer service again and they sent out a 3rd battery. The dirt bike is now dead again and worthless. This is an extreme disappointment for him. I wasted $300, lots of time and have nothing for it. Please Razor. Step up and make a decent product that works.
customer_reviews.author: Grell2theA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing purchase
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this bike. My four year old was able to maneuver it without mom/dad running along side him on his second time riding. It has enough speed to get him going but not too much that we get too worried. It is light weight enough that it can easily be loaded into the back of the car and my son can pick it back up and get on it on his own. I highly recommend this bike we have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: My grandsone loves this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandson for his birthday. He is 6 years old and absolutley loves this bike. I was worried that it would be difficult for him to ride but he got the hang of it very quickly and rides it every day. It goes about 15 mph, so not too fast considering his age. I think he will get a couple years out of it before he is ready to move up to a bigger size. Battery life is great also.
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old absolutely loves this, I was unsure of what size to get but this one will last him a year maybe two so I should've went a size larger. He was able to figure it out pretty quick and he made his new years resolution to ride his dirtbike more. The different size dirtbikes all go the same speed, they're just different heights FYI
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great but age range on packaging is wrong
customer_reviews.text: The package says for 13+ so I was worried it would be too big, but it fit my 6 year old twins perfectly. Assembly took 5 minutes if that, initial charging is 12 hours, so I should have assembled before Christmas. So far they love them. These bikes are great for younger kids, no way a 13 year old would fit, heck my 10 year old is almost too big for them.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Good little bike
customer_reviews.text: Razor makes a good product. I bought 2 Razor motorcycles for my daughters, this model and a larger one. Im a little over 200 lbs. and this little thing moves me around on pavement pretty good! It has no suspension but for a toy motorcycle in this price point , its pretty cool. I have a friend who bought his years ago and its still running with the same battery, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Luis T

customer_reviews.title: Kid enjoys it but...
customer_reviews.text: Do wish it could go up hills better. I’m thinking it must be an electric thing but he’s only 65lbs and it struggles on little hills or medium grass. Overall he seems happy with it but i wonder if we would have gotten the more powerful razor dirt bike would it still struggle in these areas? Hmmm. I still think if you are looking for a 5-8 year old it could be exactly what they need. Also if you live in a neighborhood with paved roads and dead end streets this would likely satisfy kids up to 11 or 12 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Maliska

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, fast charge, fun bike!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old loves this bike. In the 3 weeks that we've had it, he rides it often and the battery is great. The neighborhood children are all asking to ride it. It took me about 30 minutes for set up and we charged overnight prior to him first taking it out. This model is recommended for 13 years old, but, it seems to be just big enough for him so we will have to upgrade to a larger model as he gets taller.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha31407

customer_reviews.title: Great first dirt bike for little ones
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our six year old son on Christmas and it did not disappoint. The bike is easy to assemble and looks slick. Be sure to get your kid a good motorcycle helmet because with lighter weights it has some good speed and pick up. Even my older boys (and me) (and my wife) have had a great time. No issues with holding a charge. The plastic fenders are thin and will bend a bit. It also shows every scratch, but it is a dirt bike so it’s not a real concern. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Millenbaugh

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS FOR YOUR BOY
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived yesterday...charged 12 hours last night as per instructions...ready to ride today. My son is in LOVE with this electric motocross bike. LOVE....the battery lasts forever. I had a 9 year old on it for a good majority of the day (it's his), and also a 13 year old and an adult. It just kept going and going. The battery still hadn't died when it was time for it to come in for the night. A definite must buy. Just for description purposes, it is small. My son is a very very skinny 9 year old (58 pounds) and average height, and he seems to be very tall for it, though the bike propels him quite fast.
customer_reviews.author: RHemp

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my son back in September he has only ridden it like 5 times and it’s been in the garage the whole time . I went to get it out for him since the weather is nice now and the bike will not work at all it says it’s charged the lights comes on but when you hit the throttle it’s does not work . I would not recommend on wasting you money on this product at all .
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, easy to assemble, my son loves it
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my six year-old, and he has absolutely loves it. Per some of the other reviewers, this is NOT a good gift for a 13 year-old. At the time of this video, my son was 46” tall and 44 pounds. Assembly is a breeze, and that’s coming from someone who always seems to mess up the assembly process. The dirt bike holds about an hour charge, but does take a while to charge up. That would be my one negative piece, but it’s worth it. Overall, son loves the bike. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, totally worthless
customer_reviews.text: After reading a ton of reviews I decided to take my chances as Razor is a decent company. The razor dirt bike has been ridden 3 times in the 3 months we've owned it and it no longer works at all. The first time it last 15 minutes, then 3 minutes, then about 1 minute, and now nothing. We followed all manufacturers recommendations and it's never been left outside. Save your money and buy something else!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kulp

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 5 year old grandson, which he is small, about 40 lbs. And it fits him perfectly. He actually uses his feet to help stop, as the hand brake is wide for his hand and hard for him to pull. But Christmas day he took right off on it and loved it. Have noticed where our property is wet from all the rain it runs slower in the soggy yard and the thicker grass. Hopefully when it dries out he can go faster.
customer_reviews.author: rcacarrier

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting. Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was great until it stopped working. It turns on but the wheels won’t turn. No idea what is wrong with it. I’m checking to see if there is a warranty. Got it for Christmas and he hasn’t used it that much since it was so cold. Update, turns out the chain came off. My husband was able to fix it promptly. Still works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Steph H.

customer_reviews.title: Great first dirt bike for your kids.
customer_reviews.text: My children LOVE these bikes, they last forever on a charge, they are fun and cool. No need to worry about gas engine or maintenance. It takes a little getting used to the instant torque of a electric motor but I love them! We own 2 and may end up with another one if I find one for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for a little kid
customer_reviews.text: My son got this when he was four and a half. He had a Peg-Parego John Deere Tractor since he was two, and then a Razor ATV when he was four, so he had a lot of experience driving. He could ride a bike already, so balance wasn't an issue. It's a great little vehicle, and the battery -- maintained right -- lasts. A no-brainer if you're looking for something like this.
customer_reviews.author: C. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Great little dirt bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought this dirt bike for my 9 year old for Christmas. It was very easy to put together. He loved it and it's working great for now, but it is on the smaller side. It's great for the price and he's going to enjoy it for this year. If it was in the budget, I would have purchased the next size up without a doubt. But overall, this is a great little dirt bike.
customer_reviews.author: WorkingMom456

customer_reviews.title: Fun dirt bike
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old son rides everyday. It say 12 years or older but its got to be 12 year old the size of a kindergartner to ride it. I would say after about 8 to 9 years old is about the age limit other wise it would be to small for old kids. We have for sure got our moneys worth out of it just in the few months we had it.
customer_reviews.author: Walker D

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great for little kids and a respectable price. Manufacturer recommends product for 13 year old kids but it is way too small for this age group. Turn radius is limited for some odd reason. This is not for aggressive off-road riding, the chain will come off the sprocket with jumps or hard bumps. It's easy to put back on though. Loads of fun for all the kids in the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Woman

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for a 9 year old.
customer_reviews.text: My son is 9 and wanted this. He saved his birthday money and bought it himself and has used it frequently for the past 2 months. The battery life is good and our adult neighbor is able to ride (a petite female). The only concern is occasionally the throttle needs to be 'pumped' a few times to get the motor to engage but this could be due to a weakened battery and doesn't seem to be an issue when it is fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M Tague

customer_reviews.title: My 5 year old son LOVES this thing
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old is over the moon about this little dirtbike. Lots of fun for him. My 8yr old, while he likes it, you can visibly tell it's not fast enough for him, he's a little too big, even though he's a very small kid. It's very easy to ride though and even the few times my kids have taken a spill it doesn't really go fast enough to hurt them. I would definitely purchase this for a 5, 6 year old kid that knows how to ride a bike.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Easley

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap design, the speed control is so cheaply ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap design, the speed control is so cheaply made that it only lets your child go full speed or nothing imagine how dangerous that is for your child also very bumpy, imposible to ride off-road it has no shocks at all
customer_reviews.author: sweetcakedecor*com

customer_reviews.title: 30 minutes of riding
customer_reviews.text: It's what they don't tell you...this bike will only last 30 measly minutes off of the required 12 hour charge. Other reviewers would have done everyone a service by mentioning this flaw. What kid only wants to ride 30 minutes a day?
customer_reviews.author: S. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Brand new, wont run!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked once and will not charge or tun snymore. Just purchased for Christmas 2017. I cannot get any details for contacting seller, extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Bianca

customer_reviews.title: It get ridden all day, everday
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son on his 8th birthday. People think it's small but it's perfect for his size to learn the mechanics and have fun without worrying about tipping over. Plenty of power on the little electric motor and the brakes are great. He can put his little sister on it and go ride for at least 45 minutes before having to charge again. No worrying about gas, oil, hot exhaust...etc. He plugs it in himself and the most I have had to do is fix the chain 1 time.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last past the first day
customer_reviews.text: I had to call Razor warranty as the throttle stopped working just after using it 2-3 times. We charged it overnight and it still did not work the next day. Razor's warranty guy tells you to get some tools to take it apart to see if there are any 'loose wires'. There wasn't. So I've taken apart this motorbike, and they are sending me the replacement part that goes into the battery that they give me the option of fixing myself or taking it into a shop that is not near me. I've had Razor scooters before that didn't last...I don't know why I stooped into buying this bike. Get a gas powered one instead....
customer_reviews.author: ILoveCorn

customer_reviews.title: Front tire will not stay aired
customer_reviews.text: Need to talk to someone about right front tire. It seems to have a leak at the valve stem since we got it. Have to keep airing up, then goes flat within minutes. There is no one to contact. Please help. Update, still cannot find anyone to ask about the tire issue. No seller contact information.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca trubee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first motor bike!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son's 5th birthday. He loves it assembly is easy has all the tools you need in the box. It's faster than expected so get a full face helmet. A bicycle helmet wont cut it. The throttle speed isn't variable. Its either off or on. The bike is holding up well and worth the price. If you child is 8-10 and good on bikes. You should probably get the larger version.
customer_reviews.author: PolitelySevereD

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift. A surprise for a neighbor kid who's Mom is sick. He loves it! He rides it up and down the street all day everyday.
customer_reviews.author: B Noel

customer_reviews.title: Charge it after every use
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves it, I've even ridden it with him, combined weight of 170lbs we had alot of fun on it until he was able to take over , he rides it for hours a day, had to adjust the brake lever so he could stop, its now over a year old, hes ridden in dusty dirt and mud and it's still going.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Reece

customer_reviews.title: Fits our 5-year-old
customer_reviews.text: Our little boy is 50 inches tall and weights 49lbs. He fits this bike well. Never in a million years would this work for an average size 13 year old. The "power" behind this bike is perfect for a small child who has never rode a dirt bike before. It gets around our yard fine- grass and is pretty flat. We also take it on some paved trails and it does hills well. Our little boy can ride his regular bike fine without training wheels and this was the next step.. The bike is not heavy for him.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Crouse

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with bad batteries! Won’t go.
customer_reviews.text: Bike came and the batteries were bad. Charged it for 15 hours and went to throttle and it only made a clicking sound. Update: called tech support, after tearing it apart (brand new by the way) it also had a bad break/engine kill control switch. Won’t do expedited shipping for the replacement part cuz “we don’t do that” so now Santa’s gift will not be working for Christmas Day! Extremely disappointed and shocked at the awful customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jakettington

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike for beginner
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old grandson loves riding this bike on our 5 acres. Excellent bike for beginner. Stopping and starting are easy. The bike has good pickup and speed. Good on both dirt and pavement. 🏍
customer_reviews.author: Curt erskine

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves this bike! I was worried he couldnt handle it, but he jumped right on and is loving it. This bike doesnt have gradual speed increase, once you twist, it goes full on. Be ready for that. Overalll, we love it. Battery life has been great
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dekker

customer_reviews.title: Small tires go flat easy
customer_reviews.text: The bike is excellent. Still works a year later. Gave it three stars cause the tire went flat after about 4 months and I can’t find anywhere that can fix it. Local bike shop said I needed a tube so I bought the set a tube and a whole new tire almost $40 and then the bike shop couldn’t change it so I have the bike and the replacement tire but my kid can’t ride the bike anymore plus he’s pretty much outgrown it and he’s small for 13 and I think the description said it should work up to 15-16 yo.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Great little motorcycle!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 5 yr old son for Christmas. Putting it together was simple and we charged it overnight before the first ride like the instructions said. It is very sturdy and well built. He rides it all over, in dirt, grass, sidewalks, rocks, pavement, and it is a great bike with enough power to keep all 3 kids entertained. The only issue was the innertubes came with defective valve stems and leaked from the beginning, but Razor customer service sent replacements immediately, so no big deal. We are extremely happy with this motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Son really loves this bike. Speed is good enough to keep him entertained, but not so much to be scary (for the adult). Battery life pretty impressive and seems like it is sturdy and will last a while. My neighbor has the same model and it's held up under a couple years use. Seems like a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Brought much happiness for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Love it—well, as much as a parent can love their child’s toy. I am a small mom who has ridden her 8 yr old’s multiple times that Santa brought! (I do have some regret Santa did not go through Walmart—a little more expensive—but that option would have offered a warranty.) Nonetheless, this toy brought my son SO MUCH excitement!!
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: My boy is 8 and loves this motorcycle.
customer_reviews.text: Great training bike and all around fun. Assembly was easy. Battery life is good, lighter riders will have more battery longevity. Very Sturdy, does not have a suspension (ridged frame). Has parts support from factory. Recommend full bmx or dirt bike helmet.
customer_reviews.author: andrew g.

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner bike or neighborhood cruiser!
customer_reviews.text: One of our best purchases. Our son rides around mainly on concrete and some dirt. Battery lasts for the better part of a few hours of riding. In dirt, I recommend lower tire pressure just like on a gas bike. The battery will not last as long in dirt but the bike does great riding around on flat ground and smaller hills! Don’t let your kid brake skid because that made our tire susceptible to nails, gotten two already.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Dirt Bike for smaller Kids, Love it.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I read a bunch of reviews before buying it, so I was a little nervous. But.....our razor motorcycle has been PERFECT, my kid has been riding it in the dirt, the snow, the street, it performs perfectly, he loves it, he is Five years old, I recommend this bike as a Beginner bike for kids before the gas powered bikes. So if you are thinking about getting one, I say go for it, I think Razor has worked out all the bugs from earlier models. Also; the battery has lasted at least 30 minutes, my son has not worn out the battery yet, he gets tired before the battery does, so thats great.
customer_reviews.author: The Well Church

customer_reviews.title: Great little bike!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little bike! We got this for my 9 year old for Christmas. While it seems to fit him just fine, it will probably only have a couple of years on it before he outgrows it’s. But I’m so glad we got it now. He loves it, it’s a great size for him and it’s super fun!
customer_reviews.author: M Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great first dirt bike
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 7 yr old for Christmas who had outgrown power wheels. He gets about 45 mins worth of riding on a fully charged battery. Would definitely recommend if you're looking for a step up from power wheels but not quite ready for gas powered. It's been perfect, he has a blast!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: My son rides this thing every day!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old rides this mo-ped every single day. We did have a problem once with the chain popping off, but after a solid 2 hours of taking it apart my husband and I figured out the problem and fixed it. It goes about 15 mph and is super fun for kids of all ages. Several kids in our neighborhood have these and they all ride together often.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Margeson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We have a small 8 yr old and he fits perfectly on this bike. He LOVES it! It goes pretty fast for him, and not too fast for Mom. It seems pretty sturdy and so far we haven't had any issues with battery life.
customer_reviews.author: libdsjt

customer_reviews.title: I was hesitant but it is just fine for a 6 or 7 year old!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old got this for his birthday and loves it! It's perfectly safe for kids who can balance a bicycle on two wheels. Recommend Razor helmet and Mongoose knee and elbow, pads to go with it. It's fast and the neighborhood kids are jealous. This bike will smoke a scooter, regular bike or 4 wheel power wheel with its speed. I tried to jog along side him and definitely could not keep up. It's the perfect size for an average 6 or 7 year old. I can't imagine an 11 or 12 year old on this bike, it would be way too small.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Son is so happy with his purchase
customer_reviews.text: My son is 12, medium build, and while this bike looks too small for him - it's great! Goes up to 14 mph and all the other kids in the hood want one. It was a great deal (on sale) and he paid for it himself. He's so proud! Now, there aren't really any shocks so... he rides it more on the asphalt than on any dirt/trail/mountain. That's ok though, we live in suburbia.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Zalewski

customer_reviews.title: Missing the parts to operate
customer_reviews.text: Product ordered as NEW, received and upon opening was missing the charger, the owner’s manual, handlebar clamps, and included tools to assemble. We had to look up the manual pdf online to discover what parts we were missing. And so the only gift my son asked for this Christmas is sitting useless. Very disappointing!! Razors customer service line is apparently closed from Dec. 23- Jan. 2, 2020 so there goes being able to order the missing parts in a timely manner. Not a pleased customer!
customer_reviews.author: M.A.K.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon WILL NOT LET YOU RETURN THIS ITEM!!!  Dead after two days.
customer_reviews.text: After two days of use it started making a grinding sound, and the wheel would not move. No one actually answers the support phone number. And the cherry on Top Amazon will not returns on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller kids
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our very Small 7 year old. He loves it, but it’s obvious he will outgrow it within a year. There’s no way that this would fit a 13 year old. The speed is great for a small child, but I do not suggest for anyone over 70 pounds!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: He was more than satisfied with the Razor
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his dirtbike! Still going strong after a year of use! Long battery time! We did purchase a helmet. He is 7 and loves to jump hills. He wanted a gas powered, but mama didn't. He was more than satisfied with the Razor. My 13 year old weighs about 100 lbs and rode it just fine. But his long legs kept him from riding for longer. Grass areas do make the battery run down faster. Quiet on the street, so neighbors are happy, If you purchase, please get a helmet with it. The dirtbike goes a lot faster than you would think when your kid is riding.
customer_reviews.author: kELLY mCnEILL

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: It was broken after 4 months of very light use. The battery has a 90 day warranty on it. Customer support was decent and only wanted to charge me $90 to replace the batteries (but that includes shipping). Was used probably 15-20 times. Total piece of garbage now. what a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Travis S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this for my grandson. He is 6 years old and had no problem operating it. It doesn't go to fast, unless your going down a hill. I would suggest for sure buying a helmet and gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie

customer_reviews.title: False Description
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 year olds birthday. After reading the description and it saying for13+year olds, thought it would be perfect since he is a big boy. No! This bike is not for big kids definitely not 13 and up. maybe a 5year old! This bike is so small. And.. After seeing the bike is way too small and their description is so false, tried to return the bike still in the box and they would not accept the return. Now I am stuck with a bike that is too small for my son and what a waste of Money! Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Loeser

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough for 50lb kid
customer_reviews.text: My kid is 50 lbs and it doesn't have enough power to go up more than a gradual hill without a long run at it. We live in a semi hilly area and it just isn't powerful enough. If you live in a tract house, the power will be fine on the street. But out in the country, or on hills, it REALLY struggles. My 5 year old has to get off and push it on a number of small hills. ALMOST has to push it on our gravel driveway..
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Durden

customer_reviews.title: Good option to introduce a motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: If your kid is very comfortable on a bicycle, he should be good on this. I wish it has shock absorbers, but probably it would be higher price. My kid is happy
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, and loads of fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: The boys have truly enjoyed this bike. I have a 4, 6, and 12 year old that ride on this bike. This is a great, and relatively inexpensive way to progressively introduce motorsports to the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Cook

customer_reviews.title: Use a helmet for the young ones!
customer_reviews.text: Just what we ordered. Actually my 3.5 year old was able to ride around our neighborhood the first day he rode it. Can’t even ride a bicycle yet but loved this thing. Video of his literal first time on.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered for 9yo
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 year old (67 lbs) boy. It is a little under powered in my opinion. Would not get up a slight grass incline without a running start. Nice product but wish I would have got it for him 3 years ago. Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Doug G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bike
customer_reviews.text: At first the bike didn’t come with all the required parts, but a call to the company and they got it to us in a reasonable time. So far my son loves his razor and looks forward to all the dirt and mud that he rides through. It’s a great little bike and easy to operate, the brakes are a touch hard for him to squeeze. But all and all tough little bike we bought it for Christmas and it’s been really fun. Even our 12 yr old rides it
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Watch the chain
customer_reviews.text: *update I called Razor support which was awesome and discovered that chain just slipped off. Easy fix. Hopefully it doesn’t happen often. So I have updated my review. Broke after one use
customer_reviews.author: Yemi A.

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking about buying one of these, just do it!! Our kids start riding them as soon as they learn how to ride a bike and our 13 yr old still has fun on his!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: 1st step to motocross
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my four year old son. It was delivered quickly and extremely easy to put together (about 20 minutes). It does require to be charged for 12 hours before the first use. Once charged it works great! My child loves his and rides it at least three times a week. Your child should be able to ride a bike (without training wheels) before you allow them to ride this. The only down side to this machine is the hand brake. Its very hard to pull back and it kills the motor when pulled. It could cause a child to wreck in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: WV momma

customer_reviews.title: Store at 32 degrees. Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old loves it. It is well built and easy to put together. One thing to keep in mind is that if you live in a colder climate, it has to be stored in a heated space. To preserve battery life, it cannot get colder than 32 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.M

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Mini Bike
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 7 year old. He is about 65 pounds. He is telling me what to write - "I think you should buy it. It's really good. I have a lot of fun riding it." From the Mom, it shipped fast. It was very easy to put together. My son has been having so much fun riding this bike around our yard. We also got the helmet. I would recommend this bike as long as you think you child can handle it. I have a 13 year old and he is WAY too big for it.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Younger children dream about it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept and so did the grandkids- Very solid, sturdy machine. Well engineered but I believe the weight to battery life is a bit over the cap. Bike operates very good for twenty minutes of stop and go riding by a six and a seven year old that weigh 40- 45 lbs. Their travel distance between charging is approximately 5 miles of stop and go.
customer_reviews.author: Kanawha Jarrells

product_meta.title: Razor MX350 Dirt Rocket Electric Motocross Off-road Bike for Age 13+, Up to 30 Minutes Continuous Ride Time, 12" Air-filled Tires, Hand-operated Rear Brake, Twist Grip Throttle, Chain-driven Motor
product_meta.description:
The Razor Dirt Rocket MX350 is a miniature electric motocross bike. Scaled down dirt bike design carries riders up to 150 lbs. Geared for dirt with large 10" pneumatic knobby tires for maximum power transfer. Can travel over 10 miles on a single charge. Variable speed, chain driven motor for a super quiet yet powerful operation. At speeds up to 12 mph, the dirt rocket leaves similiar pocket dirt bikes in itsdust. Fairings- Shatter-resistant plastic

AMAZON.COM
Get out in the dirt with the MX350 Electric Motocross Bike from Razor's Dirt Rocket line. The MX350 Dirt Rocket is a scaled down, electric powered motocross bike that offers younger riders a way to live out their off-road fantasies. With a high torque motor, large, knobby tires, and speeds up to 12 miles per hour, the MX350 leaves similar pocket dirt bikes in its dust.

 Features:

 * Super quiet, single speed, chain driven motor 
 * High torque motor 
 * Large, knobby tires 
 * Speeds up to 12 miles per hour 
 * Twist grip throttle control 
 * Adjustable riser handlebars 
 * Hand operated rear brake 

 Specifications:

 * 350 watt electrical motor 
 * 24V (two 12V) sealed lead acid battery 
 * Battery charge time: 12 hours 
 * Up to 30 minutes of continuous use 
 * UL approved charger 
 * Assembled Dimensions: 44 x 24.5 x 31 inches 
 * Weight: 70.25 pounds 
 * Weight Limit: 140 pounds 

 About Razor USA:
Founded in 2000 with the introduction of its now legendary kick scooter which quickly became an essential ride for anyone on the go, the Razor brand embodies the spirit of fun and freedom. Today, Razor offers a full line of products that inspire and excite riders everywhere. From day one, Razor has focused on providing the very best riding experience. Based in Cerritos, Calif., the company's award-winning products are influenced by its Southern California home. The company combines cutting-edge technology, high-quality materials, and strict safety standards to deliver a product that is designed to suit riders' evolving lifestyle. Cool products and great value have distinguished Razor as a trusted brand and industry leader--from motocross and BMX, to snowboarding, skateboarding, and surfing, Razor products are rooted in popular action sports. It's not how you ride, but how the ride makes you feel.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
